DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Availability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria  Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions that address specimen availability as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Specimen Availability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Updated Definition and alternate names D Warzel

Property.preferredDefinition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is archival FFPE tissue colle
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival FFPE tissue collected within the past 36 months prior to registration available for submission for DNA/RNA analysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tissue and blood available for submission to the EET Biobank less than or equal to 14 days prior to course 1 day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tumor tissue available for shipment to the University of Wisconsin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tissue available and less than 6 months old or will fresh tissue be obtained for submission to the ETCTN Biorepository?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival FFPE tissue available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is specimen available for submission to the ETCTN biorepository?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tissue block or slides available for submission to Cheng Laboratory, Montefiore Medical Center, Albert Einstein Comprehensive Cancer Center?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have archival FFPE tissue available for central confirmation of HER2 testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival (or baseline) sample available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival Formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue block or slides available for submission?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tumor tissue block (strongly preferred), slides available, or patient willing to undergo a biopsy for tissue submission to the Biorepository?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor rich tissue block or slides available for submission to Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tissue (FFPE block or slides) available for submission to the EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is specimen available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is specimen for eligibility available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival specimen available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival specimen (FFPE Block or 20 unstained slides) available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the expansion phase, is archival or baseline specimen available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is FFPE block (optional) or slides available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival specimen (FFPE Block or slides) available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tissue available for submission to Yale Clinical Molecular Pathology Laboratory or local lab for pre-enrollment testing (Dose Escalation: for patients where TMZ is not standard of care and Phase 2: all patients)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are baseline specimens (tissue cores and blood) available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue block available for local surgical pathology review with subsequent submission of unstained slides to the EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the dose escalation cohort (DL2 or higher) or the dose expansion cohort (if baseline biopsy is not available), is archival tissue available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tumor tissue available at the time of patient enrollment for molecular profiling studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are slides from archival FFPE tissue available for submission to Iavarone Laboratory University of Miami Miller School of Medicine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are baseline specimens (tissue cores and blood) available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival specimen (or baseline specimen) available for submission to EET Biobank?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are slides from archival FFPE tissue available for submission to EET Biobank?
